servinfo.title: Main Bearings, Crankshaft and Cylinder Block Removal and Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Main Bearings, Crankshaft and Cylinder Block Components:M16A

s1.ptxt: Remove engine assembly from vehicle referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation:M16A .
Remove clutch cover, clutch disc and flywheel by using special tool.
Remove piston and connecting rod referring to Pistons, Piston Rings, Connecting Rods and Cylinders Removal and Installation:M16A .
Remove rear oil seal housing (1).
Loosen main bearing cap No.1 and No.2 bolts in such order as indicated in the figure and remove them.
Remove crankshaft from cylinder block.

item.ptxt: All parts to be installed must be perfectly clean.
Be sure to oil crankshaft journals, journal bearings, thrust bearings, crankpins, connecting rod bearings, pistons, piston rings and cylinder bores.

Journal bearings, bearing caps, connecting rods, rod bearings, rod bearing caps, pistons and piston rings are in combination sets. Do not disturb such combination and make sure that each part goes back to where it came from, when installing.

s1.ptxt: Install sensor plate (1) to crankshaft (2) and tighten bolts to specified torque.

attention3.ptxt: When installing sensor plate, align spring pin (3) on crankshaft and hole of sensor plate.

s1.ptxt: Install main bearings to cylinder block.
Upper half of bearing (1), has an oil groove (2).
Install it to cylinder block (3), and the other half without oil groove to bearing cap.
Make sure that two halves are painted in the same color.
Install thrust bearings (1) to cylinder block between No.2 and No.3 cylinders. Face oil groove (2) sides to crank webs.
Confirm that dowel pins (3) are installed to intake side of each journal.
Install crankshaft to cylinder block.
Install bearing cap to cylinder block, making sure to point arrow mark (on each cap) to crankshaft pulley side. Fit them sequentially in ascending order, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5, starting from pulley side.
After applying engine oil to main bearing cap No.1 bolts ((1) – (10)) and main bearing cap No.2 bolts ((11) – (20)), tighten them gradually as follows.

attention3.ptxt: If main bearing cap No.1 bolt is reused, make sure to check main bearing cap No.1 bolt for deformation referring to “Main Bearing Cap No.1 Bolt” under Main Bearings Inspection:M16A .

s2.ptxt: Tighten bolts ((1) – (10)) to 30 N·m (3.0 kgf-m, 22.0 lbf-ft) according to numerical order as shown by using a 12 corner socket wrenches.
In the same manner as in Step a), tighten them to 50 N·m (5.0 kgf-m, 36.5 lbf-ft).
In the same manner as in Step a), retighten them to 60°.
Tighten bolts ((11) – (20)) to 25 N·m (2.5 kgf-m, 18.0 lbf-ft) according to numerical order as shown.

torqueitem.t-note: 30 N·m (3.0 kgf-m, 22.0 lbf-ft), 50 N·m (5.0 kgf-m, 36.5 lbf-ft) and then retighten by turning through 60°

attention2.ptxt: After tightening cap bolts, check to be sure that crankshaft rotates smoothly when turning it by 12 N·m (1.2 kgf-m, 9.0 lbf-ft) torque or below.

s1.ptxt: If necessary, press-fit rear oil seal (1) to oil seal housing (2) by using special tool as shown in the figure.

s1.ptxt: Apply sealant to mating surface of rear oil seal housing (1).

s1.ptxt: Install rear oil seal housing (1) and tighten bolts to specified torque by using special tool.
Install flywheel (for M/T).
Using special tool, lock flywheel, and tighten flywheel bolts to specified torque.
Install piston and connecting rod referring to Pistons, Piston Rings, Connecting Rods and Cylinders Removal and Installation:M16A .
Install engine assembly to vehicle referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation:M16A .
